item.description:
REGISTER NOW WITH http://mountgrace.org/invasives-workshop-july-20

Invasives Plant Workshop, When:  Friday, July 20, 2012 - 2:00pm - 4:00pm Where:  Harvard Forest, Petersham

 

Elizabeth Farnsworth is the Senior Research Ecologist at the New England Wild Flower Society and a Research Associate at Harvard Forest. She will offer an introduction to Go Botany, a brand new interactive, online plant sharing and identification tool. The program is designed to help citizens identify and report invasive plants around our region.

Part of the training will also take place in the field, giving participants the opportunity to identify flora around Harvard Forest. Participants are encouraged to bring laptops, ipads and iphones for easy identification. Participants will also be asked to continue stewardship work on conservation land in their area by identifying invasives and reporting them to the Go Botany blog. Whether you have photographs, sketches, stories about using the Go Botany tool or recipes for cooking with invasives your experiences will help track invasive plants in the North Quabbin region.

Invasives Workshop 7/20

The Invasives Workshop on July 20 is free but we still ask that you register to help Mount Grace plan this event and to ensure your spot.  Look below to register and be sure to specify the number of people in your party.

  • MOUNT GRACE LAND CONSERVATION TRUST

1461 Old Keene Road, Athol, MA 01331 • Ph 978-248-2043 • Fax 978-248-2053 • landtrust@mountgrace.org

group.name: Northern Central MA, Southern NH Hiking Group

item.name: Announcement - Invasive Plant Workshop, July 20 Register Now
